014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Optional;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
023
024/**
025 * Configuration class for obtaining row or column mappers.
026 * <p>
027 * This configuration is merely a convenience class, and does not have any
028 * configuration of its own. All methods delegate to {@link RowMappers} or
029 * {@link ColumnMappers}.
030 */
031public class Mappers implements JdbiConfig<Mappers> {
032    private RowMappers rowMappers;
033    private ColumnMappers columnMappers;
034
035    public Mappers() {}
036
037    @Override
038    public void setRegistry(ConfigRegistry registry) {
039        this.rowMappers = registry.get(RowMappers.class);
040        this.columnMappers = registry.get(ColumnMappers.class);
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Obtain a mapper for the given type. If a row mapper is registered for the
045     * given type, it is returned. If a column mapper is registered for the
046     * given type, it is adapted into a row mapper, mapping the first column of
047     * the result set. If neither a row or column mapper is registered, empty is
048     * returned.
049     *
050     * @param <T>  the type of the mapper to find
051     * @param type the target type to map to
052     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mapper
053     * is registered for the given type.
054     */
055    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
056    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findFor(Class<T> type) {
057        RowMapper<T> mapper = (RowMapper<T>) findFor((Type) type).orElse(null);
058        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Obtain a mapper for the given type. If a row mapper is registered for the
063     * given type, it is returned. If a column mapper is registered for the
064     * given type, it is adapted into a row mapper, mapping the first column of
065     * the result set. If neither a row or column mapper is registered, empty is
066     * returned.
067     *
068     * @param <T>  the type of the mapper to find
069     * @param type the target type to map to
070     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mapper
071     * is registered for the given type.
072     */
073    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
074    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findFor(GenericType<T> type) {
075        RowMapper<T> mapper = (RowMapper<T>) findFor(type.getType()).orElse(null);
076        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Obtain a mapper for the given type. If a row mapper is registered for the
081     * given type, it is returned. If a column mapper is registered for the
082     * given type, it is adapted into a row mapper, mapping the first column of
083     * the result set. If neither a row or column mapper is registered, empty is
084     * returned.
085     *
086     * @param type the target type to map to
087     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mapper
088     * is registered for the given type.
089     */
090    public Optional<RowMapper<?>> findFor(Type type) {
091        return findFor(QualifiedType.of(type)).map(rowMapper -> (RowMapper<?>) rowMapper);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Obtain a mapper for the given qualified type. If the type is unqualified,
096     * and a row mapper is registered for the given type, it is returned. If a
097     * column mapper is registered for the given qualified type, it is adapted
098     * into a row mapper, mapping the first column of the result set. If neither
099     * a row or column mapper is registered, empty is returned.
100     *
101     * @param type the target qualified type to map to
102     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mapper
103     * is registered for the given type.
104     */
105    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findFor(QualifiedType<T> type) {
106        if (type.getQualifiers().isEmpty()) {
107            Optional<RowMapper<T>> result = rowMappers.findFor(type.getType()).map(m -> (RowMapper<T>) m);
108            if (result.isPresent()) {
109                return result;
110            }
111        }
112
113        return columnMappers.findFor(type).map(SingleColumnMapper::new);
114    }
115
116    @Override
117    public Mappers createCopy() {
118        return new Mappers();
119    }
120}
